text: For users located outside the jurisdiction of the United States, Howdy operates and processes data in the United States.

For example: If you purchase our Product, we may receive information from our third-party payment processors.
For example: We may collect information from unaffiliated third parties so that we can better understand you and provide you with information and offers that may interest you.
Please note that even if you delete information from your account, or deactivate your account, we may retain certain information as required by law or for legitimate business purposes.
The retention periods applied by Howdy comply with applicable legislation then in effect, namely: For data collected based on your consent to receive marketing communications, we will use the data until you withdraw your consent or applicable law requires that such data is no longer used.

We provide the representations and information in this section in compliance with European privacy laws, in particular the European General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

We may collect automated error reports in the case of software malfunctions, which may contain some or all of the information in your account and content and may be reviewed to help resolve problems with the Product.
We may also retain cached or archived copies of your information for a certain period of time.
If you participate in a training or product course, we collect completion data.
We store, process, and maintain files and content that you create and/or upload using our Product, as well as other data related to your account in order to provide the Product to you.

data_type: information about source refer you to we
text: If you arrive at Howdy from an external source (such as a link on another website or in an email), we record information about the source that referred you to us.
Howdy stores the information we collect for as long as necessary for the purpose for which it was originally collected and in compliance with our legal obligations.

We may collect information that you provide when using our Product, such as when you: (1) create an account; (2) subscribe to our Product; (3) participate in events or promotions; (4) send questions or comments via email or live chat; (5) interact with our sales or customer support team; (6) apply for a job with us online; (7) fill out surveys; or (8) otherwise communicate with us through or about our Product.
Like most websites today, our web servers keep log files that record data each time a device accesses those servers.
Any payment transactions will be encrypted using SSL technology; all payment data is stored by our payment processors and is never stored on our servers.
